snippet: Aereo, a streaming TV service, was cleared last week by a federal appeals court to stream programming it gets free from broadcasters. Fox and other broadcasters are pondering their next move.
abstract: Fox and Univision executives raise prospect of one day moving their programming off broadcast airwaves and exclusively onto cable in stepped-up response to streaming TV service Aereo; service is cleared by federal appeals court to stream programming it gets free from broadcasters.
lead_paragraph: Aereo, a streaming TV service, was cleared last week by a federal appeals court to stream programming it gets free from broadcasters. Fox and other broadcasters are pondering their next move.

headline.main: 2 Networks Hint at Leaving the Airwaves
headline.print_headline: 2 Networks Hint at Leaving the Airwaves
